text: The ranks and insignia of the Forest protection (Reichforstschutz) were the paramilitary rank system used by the national Forest protection agency in Germany during World War II. The collar tabs and shoulder boards underlay identified the service. Green for State Forestry Service, gray for Communal Forestry Service, black for Luftwaffe and Heer Forestry Service and brown for Private Forestry Service. ==Rank Insignia== ===Ranks (1934–1938)=== {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background-color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font- size:95%; margin: 0px 12px 12px 0px;" |- style="text-align:center;" ! Shoulder insignia ! Name ! Translation |- style="text-align:center;" | | Generalforstmeister | General Forest Master |- style="text-align:center;" | | Oberlandforstmeister | Senior country forest master |- style="text- align:center;" | | Landforstmeister | Country forest master |- style="text- align:center;" | | Oberforstmeister | Senior forest master |- style="text- align:center;" | | Forstmeister | Forest master |- style="text-align:center;" | | Forstassessor | Forest Assessor |- style="text-align:center;" | | Forstreferendar | District forester |- style="text-align:center;" | | Forstamtmann | Forestry Office man |- style="text-align:center;" | | Oberförster | Senior Ranger |- style="text-align:center;" | | Revierförster | Area Ranger |- style="text-align:center;" | | Förster | Ranger |- style="text- align:center;" | 100px | Hilfsförster | Auxiliary Ranger |- style="text- align:center;" | | Unterförster | Under Ranger |- style="text-align:center;" | | Forstaufseher | Forester |- style="text-align:center;" | No insignia | Forstanwärter | Forester Candidate |- style="text-align:center;" |Source: |} ===Ranks (1938–1942)=== {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background- color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font-size:95%; margin: 0px 12px 12px 0px;" |- style="text-align:center;" !
